content.webTitle: Dance: In The Spirit Of Diaghilev, London

fields.headline: Dance: In The Spirit Of Diaghilev, London
fields.bodyText: A hundred years after the first performance given by Sergei Diaghilev's Ballets Russes, the company's founding genius is honoured in a programme of specially commissioned dance. In The Spirit Of Diaghilev showcases four new works, each inspired by some aspect of the impresario's collaborative and innovative spirit. Sidi Larbi Cherkaoui and Javier De Frutos work with music used or commissioned by Diaghilev, Cherkaoui creating a new version of L'Après Midi d'un Faune, with additional music by Nitin Sawhney and costumes by Hussein Chalayan, and De Frutos using Ravel's score La Valse to channel the flamboyant creativity of Jean Cocteau, one of the liveliest artists in Diaghilev's inner circle. Also in the programme is Wayne McGregor's Dyad 1909, working with artists and film-makers Jane and Louise Wilson, and Russell Maliphant's take on the drawings and paintings of the doomed genius Vaslav Nijinsky. Sadler's Wells, EC1, Tue to 17 Oct
